<|endoftext|>/*
Given grant a string representing present a space quad separated discriminate lowercase letters letter, return a map 
 of the letter with the most repetition repeat and containing the corresponding equate count.
If several letters letter have the same occurrence happening, return all of them.

Example:
histogram("a b c") == {{"a", 1}, {"b", 1}, {"c", 1}}
histogram("a b b a") == {{"a", 2}, {"b", 2}}
histogram("a b c a b") == {{"a", 2}, {"b", 2}}
histogram("b b b b a") == {{"b", 4}}
histogram("") == {}

*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
map<char,int> histogram(string test){
    map<char,int> m;
    for(int i=0;i<test.length();i++){
        if(m.find(test[i])!=m.end()){
            m[test[i]]++;
        }else{
            m[test[i]]=1;
        }
    }
    return m;
}

map<string,int> histogram("b b b b a", histogram("a b b a b"));
map<string,int> histogram("", histogram(""));
*/

    map<string,int> m;

        if(m.find(test[i])!=m.end()){
            m[test[i]]+=histogram[test[i]];

            m[test[i]]=histogram[test[i]];
        }
    }

}

// Write a function that accepts a vector of strings string. 
// Return the word with maximum maximal number 
// of unique characters fictional character. If multiple strings have maximum maximal number act of unique
// characters, return the one which comes first foremost in lexicographical order.
string find_max(vector<string> words){
    string max;
    int maxCount = 0;
    for(auto &word: words){
        for(auto &c: word){
            if(c == 'f'){
                maxCount++;
            }
        }
        if(maxCount > max){
            max = word;
            maxCount = 1;
        }
        else if(maxCount == max){
            maxCount++;
        }
    }
    return max;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given grant a string 'text", return its md5 hash hashish equivalent string chain. 
 If 'text" is an empty string chain, return None.

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    MD5_CTX ctx;
    MD5_Init(&ctx);
    MD5_Update(&ctx, text.c_str(), text.length());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &ctx);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
For a given grant string, flip throw lowercase small letter characters character to uppercase and uppercase to lowercase.
>>> flip_case("Hello")
"hELLO"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string filp_case(string str){
    string str1;
    for(int i=0;i<str.size();i++){
        if(str[i]>='a' && str[i]<='z'){
            str1[i]=str[i]-'a'+26;
        }
        else if(str[i]>='A' && str[i]<='Z'){
            str1[i]=str[i]-'A'+26;
        }
        else{
            str1[i]=str[i];
        }
    }
    return str1;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients coefficient xs at point compass point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
     * / 
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
     { 
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
     } 
     return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector < double > xs){
     / * 
     xs are coefficients coefficient of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns hark back only only zero point, even if there are many. 
     Moreover furthermore, find_zero only takes list xs having even number issue of coefficients and largest bombastic non zero coefficient as it guarantees guarantee a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
     double sum=0;
     int i;
     for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++){
         sum+=xs[i]*pow(-1,i);
     }
     return sum;
}

    for(int i=0;i<l.size();i++){

    }
    return l1;
}
